content: color cast on 6 sts leaving a long tail for finishing about 6 / 15 cm divide the sts over 2 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 kfb k1 kfb repeat 10 sts round 3-5 knit round 6 kfb k1 kfb k1 kfb repeat 16 sts redistribute the sts on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now has 6 sts each you may want to add a stitch marker to show where the round begins round 7 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 8 k2 kfb repeat until end of round 32 sts round 9 k3 kfb repeat until end of round 40 sts round 10 k4 kfb repeat until end of round 48 sts round 11 knit do a yarn over bind-off see video link on pg 2 weave in end to underside purl-side stem cast on 14 sts in your grass color divide the sts over 2 or 3 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 purl round 3 knit change to yellow stem color round 4-5 knit round 6 ssk k3 k2tog repeat 10 sts round 7 18 knit 12 rounds round 19 k1 m1r k3 m1l k1 repeat 14 sts round 20 knit cast off cut yarn leaving long tail for sewing onto cap in finishing do not weave in end finishing embroidery do not weave in the cast off end of your stem you will need that later to sew stem to top i used worsted for my door and sock yarn for my doorframe doorknob and window so i could be more detailed the door is made using satin stitch it is about 2 sts wide and 6 sts high see pg 2 if desired add a frame with 4 long sts try not to stitch the 2 sides together the door knob is made with a french knot my window is located 3 sts up from the top of the door and made with long sts that are about 3 sts high and 3 sts wide it has a cross inside when done hide all ends inside of stem not cast off end attaching cap and stem together make sure the cast off end of your cap is woven in push down the center of your cap with your thumb if you are having a hard time pushing it down use the cast on end to tug it downward this is now the bottom of your cap to attach the stem and cap first insert the cast on end down into the top of the stem and out the bottom then pull the cast on end down until the bottom of your cap is in your stem see photos pg 2 next use your stem s cast off end to stitch the 2 pieces together in order to keep my cap in place as i sew i put
